newsitem.title: USA: Isocor sees Q1 revenue between $3.7-4.2 mln.
newsitem.headline: Isocor sees Q1 revenue between $3.7-4.2 mln.

text.p: ISOCOR said on Tuesday based on preliminary results, revenues for the first quarter ended March 31 were expected to be between $3.7 million and $4.2 million and it expected to report a net loss for the quarter.
In first quarter of 1996 the company recorded revenues of $6.5 million and a net profit of $198,000.
ISOCOR planned to report definitive results for the first quarter during the week of April 21, 1997.

"While we strongly believe in our overall strategy and our ability to execute, the speed of transition of the market demand away from X.400 products has been more rapid than anticipated," Andy De Mari, president and chief executive, said. "We have experienced a revenue shortfall as we adjust to these new market dynamics and continue our penetration into the Internet/Intranet marketspace."
Results were preliminary and were subject to the company closing its books, it said.
